description: We have some duplicate code to create/import and manage keypairs in the EC2 and OpenStack APIs. We should create an internal keypair API (in the compute API) and use it from the EC2 and OS APIs instead.
title: de-duplicate key pair code across EC2/OS apis

comments.content: We have some duplicate code to create/import and manage keypairs in the EC2 and OpenStack APIs. We should create an internal keypair API (in the compute API) and use it from the EC2 and OS APIs instead.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dan-prince

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/7342
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/7342
Committed: http://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/ec0a65d81fd11d26be77b45827a4dd7c77711675
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit ec0a65d81fd11d26be77b45827a4dd7c77711675
Author: Dan Prince <email address hidden>
Date:   Fri May 11 10:07:06 2012 -0400

    Create an internal key pair API.
    
    Creates an internal key pair API and update the EC2 and OS API's to
    use it. This de-duplicates some of the code used to manage keypairs
    across the APIs.
    
    Fixes LP Bug #998059.
    
    Change-Id: I10d58d7ce68cc2b993c72b6639f66c72def3bfbc
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
